snippet: British prosecutors say that an editor with The Sun has been charged in connection with a conspiracy to pay  bribes to a press officer in the government’s tax department.
abstract: Clodagh Hartley, editor with British tabloid newspaper The Sun, is charged in connection with conspiracy to pay thousands of dollars’ worth of bribes to Jonathan Hall, press officer working in government’s tax department, in exchange for information on policy decisions.
lead_paragraph: British prosecutors say that an editor with The Sun has been charged in connection with a conspiracy to pay  bribes to a press officer in the government’s tax department.
